# My ECC For Dummies Challenge


We were given a source code :

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3

from Crypto.Util.number import bytes_to_long as bl
from Crypto.Util.number import getPrime
import secrets

FLAG = b"HZiXCTF{redacted}"

def keys():
	p = getPrime(1024)
	q = getPrime(1024)

	modulus = p * q

	b = secrets.randbits(512)

	rand_1 = secrets.randbits(512)
	rand_2 = secrets.randbits(512)


	b1 = pow(b, rand_1*((p << 1) + (~p)), modulus)
	b2 = pow(b, rand_2*((q << 1) + (~q)), modulus)
	rand_b1 = secrets.randbits(512)
	rand_b2 = secrets.randbits(512)

	return (p, q), (b1, rand_b1, b2, rand_b2, modulus)

def encrypt(plaintext, key1, e1, key2, e2, modulus):
	return plaintext*pow(key1,e1,modulus) % modulus , plaintext*pow(key2,e2,modulus) % modulus

def decrypt(tro, lol):
	#Oops I forgot the decryption logic, I just remember it was dead easy typical babersa xD
	pass


if _name_ == '_main_':

	plaintext = bl(FLAG)
	priv_key, pub_key = keys()
	p, q = priv_key
	key1, e1, key2, e2, n = pub_key
	print(f"Pub:\n[+] Key1 = {key1},\n[+] Exp1 = {e1}\n[+] Key2 = {key2},\n[+] Exp2 = {e2}\n[+] Modulus = {n}")
	cipher1, cipher2 = encrypt(plaintext, key1, e1, key2, e2, n)
	print(f"Cipher:\n[*]Cipher1: {cipher1},\n[*]Cipher2: {cipher2}")


	"""
	Pub:
	[+] Key1 = ,
	[+] Exp1 = 5469342234088524207782091028137909547874959970036956407852044176141704866411338476316240300140875668233899334390219777989868327579997439398171768007463620
	[+] Key2 = ,
	[+] Exp2 = 8268145165551570150959126577170197630918835189643281086039059975862119238421923401927740089303188841561560423282625445170445685209494239855590223488819301
	[+] Modulus = 
	Cipher:
	[*]Cipher1: ,
	[*]Cipher2: 
	"""
```
This challenge is similar to _Little Nightmare_ from **Cyber Apocalypse 2021**. But here we have everything so we can compute the flag easily..

![2020-12-08 18_37_24-b00t2root-2020-CTF-Crypto-Challenges_README md at main Â· MehdiBHA_b00t2root-2020](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62826765/101520233-79641300-3984-11eb-888f-1ad5c2c6d68c.png)

**Solver :**
```python
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes, inverse

key1 = 
e1 = 5469342234088524207782091028137909547874959970036956407852044176141704866411338476316240300140875668233899334390219777989868327579997439398171768007463620
c1 = 
modulus = 

inv = inverse(pow(key1, e1, modulus), modulus)
print(long_to_bytes((c1 * inv) % modulus))
```

FLAG : **HZiXCTF{F3rm4t_LiTT!3_7heoRem_f0r_3verY_B483R54}**
